name: Negligence
description: Failure to exercise reasonable care, e.g., car accidents, slip-and-fall, medical malpractice, wrongful death.

name: Assault and battery
description: Intentional act causing fear of attack (assault) or unlawful physical contact (battery).

name: False imprisonment
description: Unlawful confinement of a person without their consent.

name: Intentional infliction of emotional distress
description: Extreme or outrageous conduct that causes severe emotional harm.

name: Trespass
description: Intentional entry onto the land of another without permission.

name: Product Liability
description: Holds manufacturers, distributors, or sellers responsible for a defective product that causes harm.

name: Breach of contract
description: Failure to perform the duties stipulated in a valid and binding contract.

name: Fraudulent inducement
description: Alleging that a party was intentionally deceived into entering a contract.

name: Duress
description: Claiming a party was coerced into an agreement.

name: Lesion
description: An allegation where a contract's price is unfairly low, typically for immovable property.

name: Specific performance
description: Seeking a court order for the other party to fulfill their part of the contract, rather than paying monetary damages.

name: Boundary disputes
description: When neighbors disagree on the exact location of their property lines.

name: Servitude disputes
description: Disagreements over the right to use another person's property for a specific purpose, similar to an easement in other states.

name: Acquisitive prescription (Adverse Possession)
description: A claim to ownership of property by someone who has openly occupied it for an extended period.

name: Landlord-Tenant disputes
description: Allegations concerning rent, property maintenance, or eviction.

name: Co-ownership disputes
description: Disagreements among multiple owners of a single property.

name: Divorce
description: Allegations related to fault or no-fault grounds for ending a marriage.

name: Custody proceedings
description: Actions to determine child custody and support.

name: Filiation actions
description: Claims to establish or disavow the legal relationship between a child and a parent.

name: Child abuse and neglect
description: Legal services are mandated in cases of alleged abuse, neglect, or exploitation.

name: Protective orders
description: Allegations involving domestic violence that require a protective order.

name: Discrimination
description: Claims of discrimination based on a protected characteristic in employment, housing, or public accommodation.

name: Violations under 42 U.S.C. ยง 1983
description: This covers constitutional violations by state actors, such as allegations of excessive force by law enforcement.

name: Open account or promissory note actions
description: Claims to collect on unpaid commercial accounts or promissory notes.

name: Insurance policy disputes
description: Disputes over claims against an insurance company.

name: Suits on a judicial bond
description: Actions to recover damages from a bond.

name: Homicide
description: First degree murder, second degree murder, manslaughter, negligent homicide, vehicular homicide.

name: Feticide
description: First degree feticide, second degree feticide, third degree feticide.

name: Assault and Battery
description: Aggravated assault, simple assault, aggravated battery, second degree battery, simple battery.

name: Rape and Sexual Offenses
description: Forcible rape, simple rape, sexual battery, oral sexual battery, etc.

name: Kidnapping
description: Aggravated kidnapping, second degree kidnapping, simple kidnapping.

name: Robbery
description: First degree robbery, second degree robbery, simple robbery, carjacking.

name: Arson and Use of Explosives
description: Aggravated arson, simple arson.

name: Burglary
description: Aggravated burglary, simple burglary.

name: Theft
description: Theft, theft of a firearm, theft of livestock, etc.

name: Fraud and Forgery
description: Issuing worthless checks, forgery, identity theft, etc.

name: Gambling
description: Gambling, gambling in public, etc.

name: Obscenity
description: Obscenity, pornography involving juveniles.

name: Prostitution
description: Prostitution, soliciting for prostitutes, etc.

name: Bribery and Corrupt Influencing
description: Public bribery, bribery of sports participants, etc.

name: Treason and Disloyal Acts
description: Treason, misprision of treason.

name: Weapons
description: Illegal carrying of weapons, illegal use of weapons or dangerous instrumentalities.

name: Solicitation
description: Inciting, commanding, or urging another person to commit a felony.

name: Homicide (Murder & Manslaughter)
description: The unlawful killing of a human being. Murder typically requires malice aforethought (intent or extreme recklessness), while manslaughter involves a killing without malice (e.g., in the heat of passion or through criminal negligence). [1, 2, 3, 4]

name: Assault/Battery
description: Assault is an intentional act creating a reasonable apprehension of imminent harmful contact. Battery is the intentional harmful or offensive touching of another. They are often charged together.

name: Theft / Larceny / Burglary / Robbery
description: Theft/Larceny is the unlawful taking of property. Burglary is unlawfully entering a structure to commit a crime. Robbery is theft by force or threat of force.

name: Mail Fraud / Wire Fraud / Securities Fraud
description: Using mail, wire communication (internet, phone), or deceptive practices in stock/commodities markets to defraud others of money or property.

name: Drug Trafficking / Possession
description: The illegal sale, transportation, or distribution of controlled substances, or the knowing possession of an illegal controlled substance.

name: Negligence
description: Failure to exercise the degree of care that a reasonably prudent person would have exercised under the same circumstances. Elements are duty, breach, causation, and damages.

name: Breach of Contract
description: Failure by one party to a valid contract to perform their obligations. Elements are: (1) existence of a valid contract, (2) plaintiff's performance, (3) defendant's breach, and (4) resulting damages.

name: Divorce / Child Custody Action
description: Legal proceeding to terminate a marriage or to determine the care, control, and maintenance of a minor child.

name: Patent / Copyright Infringement
description: The unauthorized making, using, or selling of a patented invention, or the unauthorized use of works protected by copyright law.

name: Employment / Housing Discrimination
description: Discrimination in employment or housing based on protected characteristics like race, color, religion, sex, national origin, or disability.
